attributes.action: Ensure the Brexit negotiating team is politically representative
attributes.background: The UK has just voted to leave the EU and after Article 50 is triggered we will have to negotiate the terms of our disengagement within two years. Our current government gained a parliamentary majority with just 37% of the vote. It does not have a mandate to carry out these negotiations on its own.
attributes.additional_details: Requirements of negotiation: The team negotiating our terms of our disengagement from the EU should consist of MPs from all parties. The final terms should only be considered passed if voted for by a super-majority (66%) in parliament. Each constituent nation's administration shall have a veto over the terms.

attributes.action: New government to reach an agreement on Free trade and Free movement with the EU
attributes.background:
The  EU  has been the UK's largest trade partner for years. It will be
devastating for our economy to not be able to enjoy free trade with
the  EU  as  a  whole, should the UK actually leave the EU in the near
future. Same goes for free movement of UK citizens in Europe
attributes.additional_details:
Now  that  the  UK  has  voted to leave the EU, I believe it is in the
common  interest  of  British people to have a comprehensive agreement with  the  EU  as  a  whole  rather than with each individual  country, agreement  that  would give us free trade and free movement, something we have so much enjoyed whilst being a part of the EU. EU has been our biggest  trade  partner (collectively) and will continue to be such in the future. This should become the #1 priority of the new UK government.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for workers in dog shelters to kill unwanted dogs.
attributes.background: In dog shelters, workers kill unwanted dogs after a certain amount of time, which can be up to a week which doesn't give the dog a chance to live in a happy home where it is wanted. Dogs have feelings too, dogs are a man's best friend!
attributes.additional_details: http://www.dogwatchuk.com/death-row-dogs/
attributes.creator_name: Fiona Grezda, Jasmine Murphy, Alma Roe

attributes.action: Ensure the EU referendum goes ahead and we get our democratic right to decide.
attributes.background: I want to ensure the British people get their say on 23rd June as to whether we remain a part of the EU or not. A petition calling for the referendum to be cancelled and for the British government to make the decision (to stay in the EU) is circulating. Help ensure the democratic process happens.

attributes.action: A law that restricts roadworks to 5 miles in any 30 mile stretch on a motorway.
attributes.background: Over the past few years there has been significant investment in upgrading our motorway system, this has resulted in many miles of roadworks with restricted road width and an imposed fifty mile an hour speed limited that is monitored. Some roadworks go on for 15 miles plus.
attributes.additional_details: Extended roadworks (greater than 5 miles, Incl lead-in/out) with reduced lanes and a 50 Mile an hour speed limit requires significant levels of concentration. It increases the likelihood of an accident, increases traffic jams, restricts movement, increases the time it takes to get from A to B when the roadworks are for extended miles. Drivers get more frustrated, more likely to speed. When there is a 15 mile stretch of roadworks, on large stretches nobody is working anyway!

attributes.action: A review of the British High Comission Visa Department in Pakistan.
attributes.background: The British High Comission has been rejecting thousands of UK Visa applicants from Pakistan in a unsophisticated way. So I plead to the British Government to review the ongoing in Pakistan's visa department, as rate of rejection is currently higher than ever, and this is not humanly right.
attributes.additional_details: Currently, the British High Commission charges fees from Rs14,000 to Rs100,000 for visas of different categories and durations. In some cases Pakistanis have submitted a number of a applications to the BHC for visas, and paid the fee a number of times, only to be turned down without a justifiable reason. This could be in fear of terrorism, which is understandable at the current time, however this does not highlight why thousands of applicants are being tuned down without a justified reason.

attributes.action: Provide 'Be a Tree' training to children in schools.
attributes.background: I would like to see training provided to children in schools as to how to behave around dogs, in particular, the method of 'Be a Tree'.  The rationale behind this is in order to help prevent dog bites as a number of parents/adults are not aware of the behaviours that can lead to them.
attributes.additional_details: Dogs are stimulated by noise and movement. Unfortunately most children will be running around making a noise when they meet dogs. There are many kits already available, specifically aimed at teachers, such as http://www.clickertraining.com/node/3535 or http://www.be-a-tree.com/. It would be very easy for the Government to develop something similar for use in schools and is an easy way to educate everyone, as I'm sure children could be encouraged to impart what they have learned to their family.

attributes.action: Allow Gamaniel Josh Pensee to remain in the UK following notice of deportation
attributes.background: Gamaniel Josh Pensee is an accomplished amateur boxer who is due to be deported to his country of birth, he has no ties or means of living. Living in the UK since a child and boxing throughout, he is set to turn pro. The popular and friendly character inspires all, he is expecting his first child
attributes.additional_details: Gamaniel Josh Pensee is a 27 and soon to be father. He came to England with his mother aged 14 and believed he had permission to live here after his mother was granted indefinite leave to remain whilst he was still a child. It wasn’t until he tried to apply to University in his 20’s that he was made aware that his mother’s status had not automatically applied to him. After appointing a lawyer and adhering to bail conditions whilst he has sought to be granted the same status as his mother, he was suddenly detained on 13th April 2016. He was soon after issued with a notice of intention for his deportation

attributes.action: Charge us more national insurance and properly fund the NHS
attributes.background: The NHS is now running at a huge defecit. This can be easily solved. Charge us more national insurance - double it if you like. Use that money to properly/sustainably fund the NHS for a growing, ageing population. We'd much rather fund a public system for all than pay for private health insurance.

attributes.action: Compel Bookmakers to accept £100 wagers and ban closing accounts
attributes.background: Bookmakers are systematically closing accounts of any punter with even short term profits.this is totally contrary to them being licenced to accepting bets.A modest figure of £100 would hardly lay them open to nefarious acts but would equally give a fair deal.
attributes.additional_details: I am sure several thousands respondents will support this ,all with similar stories.

attributes.action: Right to choose our own school holidays passed to parents
attributes.background: I would like to see the right to flexible school holidays passed to the parents and not just governed by local councils and schools. The old system is out of date and does not reflect modern living where both parents work.
attributes.additional_details: We as parents should have the choice to take our children out of school for the 20 days holiday that the government says we are entitled to as full time employees in this country. Schools should be open 50 weeks of the year with a only a week at Christmas and Easter as compulsory terms. All other holidays should be chosen by parents with a minimum of 4 weeks to be taken during the year but obviously not during exam times.

attributes.action: Regulate and reduce hospital car parking charges.
attributes.background: My son was admitted to Gloucester Royal and on every visit we had no choice but to use their car parks.  On one occasion we parked at 15.08 and left at 16.10 and were charged 2 hours and there was no allowance for any "time" to get your ticket and vacate the car park.

attributes.action: Companies to have Defibrillators
attributes.background:
Make it a mandatory requirement for businesses who employ over 50 persons either temporary or permanent to have a AED Automatic external defibrillator.
More than 100 Sudden Cardiac Arrests (SCA) take place in the UK each week with 95% of these being at a workplace.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.suddencardiacarrest.co.uk/

attributes.action: Create more apprenticeships in policing and security.
attributes.background: After trying everything i have found there are minimal opportunities to get an apprenticeship in that professional area due to regulation on overtime and budget cuts more apprenticeships should be created in the security and policing areas to give people the experience required.
attributes.additional_details: I have been told the police no longer offer work experience by members of their staff and the security industry do not seem to provide apprenticeships, i see this as wrong because at a job interview all they will want is experience and without an apprenticeship you do not have that and they will dismiss you and hire an experienced Candidate.

attributes.action: ASPA'86 revised to ban use of animal testing and selling of tested goods in UK.
attributes.background: Since 1882 the use of animal testing has been reduced. But when the media states a reduction, it compares from the horrific state of which we treated animals to a position where we were only capable of improvement. In this age, 2016, is it still acceptable for this inhumane act to continue?
attributes.additional_details:
Most figures displayed by the media do not include animals that are bred for the purpose of testing and for use of tissue
then discarded or rejected because their genetic modifications did not work.
Use of animals:
Rodents 84%
Fish, amphibians, reptiles 12%
Large mammals 2.1%
Small mammals 1.4%
Dogs and cats 0.3%
Primates 0.1%
Scientists suggest that new drugs in development that act in very specific ways in the body may lead to more animals (specifically primates) being used in future years.

attributes.action: Create specialist knife crime units within the police.
attributes.background: In areas that have high levels of knife crime. Specialist knife crime units need to be created within the police, to tackle this ongoing issue.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.birminghammail.co.uk/news/midlands-news/black-october-knife-crime-after-12086384.amp

attributes.action: Stop the Heathrow Airport expansion
attributes.background: The UK government decided to build another runway at Heathrow Airport. This topic has been up for debate for many months & out of the 2 largest airports (Heathrow & Gatwick), the UK Government felt that another runway should be added to Heathrow. Since the news broke out, social media has received
attributes.additional_details: thousands of people expressing their concern on the #HeathrowExpansion, stating that this should have gone to Gatwck . Heathrow itself, is already a mega sized airport & as a local resident, I can tell you how bad it can be with the noise & the releasing of jet fuel on the local resident houses & the other problem is that, they are promising jobs, but what about job loses! All it takes is another major attack, & people will not fly as much, which will lead to pressure on airlines & job losses.

attributes.action: Allow the continued use of A2 motorcycle restrictor kits.
attributes.background: The plan to prohibit current use of A2 restrictor kit seems unfair to a lot of riders as this is a step up for their current A1 licence restricting the to 125cc motorcycles. The UK is one of the strictest if not the strictest when it comes to motorcycle laws,this is a step in the wrong direction.

attributes.action: Make it law that animals microchips come with a tracking device
attributes.background: Get these dogs and cats safe by having a microchip with a tracker in it and then people can locate their pets when they go missing

attributes.action: Raise the UK speed limit on Motorways and major a roads to 85
attributes.background: Will help with the flow of traffic on major A roads and motorways
attributes.additional_details: Most people already speed on motorways and major A roads and everybody know so  it so instead make it legal instead of illegal.

attributes.action: Have older drivers be assessed free of charge once hitting a particular age.
attributes.background: Every year thousands of UK drivers are involved in a road traffic collision of some kind and unfortunately a lot are OAP's. For some older people there reaction times and awareness on the road are limited.
attributes.additional_details: A goverment funded assessment should be put into place to assess any older drivers once they hit a particular age to be passed as safe to be on UK roads. By doing this thousands of lives can be saved and while not every driver above a particular age is unsafe on the road many are also unaware of there dangerous driving style. Help save lives by supporting a goverment funded assessment to unsure everyone is safe on the road.

attributes.action: Stop the Government ripoff on car road tax transfer return to old system
attributes.background: when a car is sold in the middle of the month the owner losses two weeks road tax refund and the new owner has to pay from the beginning of the month  paying for two weeks he/she has not had,so the GOV.is stealing four weeks road tax, return to the old system where the road tax can stay with the car

attributes.action: Nationalise Utility companies and regenerate UK infrastructure with the profits.
attributes.background: The privatised utility companies run a virtual monopoly with an arcane pricing structure designed to confuse. There was no evidence of significantly more inefficiency when they were previously in public ownership and unlike transport we all rely absolutely on utility companies for our wellbeing.
attributes.additional_details: I believe that given the option the majority of people in the UK would support a return to public ownership,  regardless of political persuasion. If necessary this might be an option for the larger metropolitan areas to run as pilot schemes initially , with a local poll conducted independently of any political party.

attributes.action: Make the use of parent and child parking spaces in car parks badge holders only!
attributes.background: When parking with young children in car parks extra door space is needed. Most car parks provide this facility but unfortunately some people don't think they need to have children in the car to use these spaces. I think the introduction of a badge system to use these spaces is needed to stop this.
attributes.additional_details: Every time I use or try to use these spaces that are provided for parents with children I see others use them with no children in the car. I think that this lack of consideration is very infuriating and every parent I have spoken to agrees. At one time or another I'm sure like me you have struggled to get your children out of a small space because maybe that last space had been taken by someone who didn't actually need it. If you agree with me please sign this petition

attributes.action: Keep present allowances for disabled and assisted accomodation tenants.
attributes.background: The present efforts by the government to attack the poorest and most vulnerable in our society must stop.I work with both the disabled and the homeless who do not have a voice. Help me and sign this petition to be their voice.
attributes.additional_details: Rental allowances from benefit are capped and often fall short of the required amount- which then has to be topped up from benefits- often leaving individuals with less than £60 a week for all their needs (food, toiletries, transport, household goods etc) This is inhuman treatment of the most vulnerable in our society who need our help and support.The allowances should be kept and increased yearly in line with the cost of living index.

attributes.action: Make it law that all bus companies must have space for 2 wheelchairs and a Pram
attributes.background:
Were asking that we catch up with mainland europe when it comes to disability access especially on transport such as buses who currently only allow one wheelchair and a pram.

Disabled people travel together and to expect them to catch separate buses so they can go out together is disgraceful!
attributes.additional_details:
Its time we caught up with mainland europes public transport giving a minimum of 2 priority wheelchair spaces on each bus and a space for 1 or 2 prams.

Wheelchair users find it hard to use public transport but if your a wheelchair user with another friend whos a wheelchair user you find it impossible to go out together as you have to take separate buses some which could be an hour apart.

Its time the companies providing the service were made to make this a requirement making it fairer for all

attributes.action: Allow MOD personnel to cook meals within SLA using issued or personal appliances
attributes.background: Safety regulations have resulted in the banning of any cooking appliances other than microwave and toaster within SLA. This makes PAYD the only option on camps for eating a hot meal, allowing for monopoly by contractors. Personnel should be allowed the option of cooking their own meals if they wish.

attributes.action: Seek a UN treaty on mutual recognition and enforcement of telephone privacy laws
attributes.background: Despite using the TPS, I have been bombarded with spam telephone calls from India and some other foreign countries. Many of these calls are barely disguised scams. Within the EU there is mutual recognition of such schemes and it works well. This should be extended by treaty to all nations in the ITU
attributes.additional_details:
TPS = Telephone Preference Service
ITU = International Telecommunications Union, a UN agency

To understand what gave me this idea, see: https://www.quora.com/What-is-the-creepiest-phone-call-or-voice-message-youve-ever-received/answer/Peter-Charlot and my (Charles Stuart) comment.

Ofcom recognizes that people outside the EU are beyond their control. I would like a treaty to address this and set up mandatory reciprocal recognition of cold calling laws among ITU member states.

attributes.action: Drug test all ministers and senior civil servants including the military
attributes.background: Rig workers are tested to avoid destroying the North Sea in fact lots of employers demand a pre employment tests. Our representatives are running the country and far too many senior politicians behave and look like they are on much more than fairy dust .We deserve the best.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to park on or in front of a dropped kerb and private driveways.
attributes.background: Current high way code rules recommend that people do not block private driveways. As this is not an illegal action, people suffer the consequences of irresponsible parking by others. The move to make this action illegal and therefore give the police power to discourage problems.

attributes.action: Reduce the Foreign Aid budget and use the monies to fund Social Housing
attributes.background: Reduce the Foreign Aid Budget and use the monies to fund a Social Housing scheme to ensure all UK Veterans and homeless families have somewhere safe to live.  Any monies left can also fund Social Housing for the rest of the Country and then use the rents raised towards upkeep.

attributes.action: Stop Sexual Harrassment in Schools
attributes.background:
A 2010 YouGov poll of 16-18 year olds found 29% of girls experienced unwanted sexual touching at school and a further 71% said they heard sexual name-calling towards girls at school daily or a few times per week.
We want it to be made law for schools to train teachers on how to prevent this.
attributes.additional_details:
Data published in September 2015 showed that 5,500 sexual offences were recorded in UK schools over a three year period, including 600 rapes. 
In 2015 Girlguiding UK found 90% of young women aged 13-21 agree that the government should make sure all schools are addressing sexual harassment and bullying in schools.

attributes.action: Stop foreign workers taking British jobs in culturally important industries
attributes.background: We petition the Government to apply any immigration controls implemented Post Brexit to all industries, even culturally important ones, with very few exceptions even if the company or foreigner is extremely rich. Especially where there are young British people eager to do the jobs with the skills
attributes.additional_details: This must be applied to all, particularly to Sports clubs and especially football. The only exception should be that each club is allowed 1 coach & 1 player to be non Brit. The invasion of football with foreigners is hurting the ability of young Brits to develop & gain experience, this is hurting the national team. There are 100's of talented young Brits who could fill these roles so foreigners aren't required. Culturally significant industries are Sport, Media and Show business.

attributes.action: Limit maximum private parking charges.
attributes.background: This petition is to get a law in place to limit the maximum fine private parking companies can charge to £60 and a minimum of a 50% discount if paid within 14 days.

attributes.action: Return the railways to full state control and ownership
attributes.background:
High prices, rotten service on our trains..Let get our railways back to full state ownership so profits benefit train users not shareholders..
Each private contract ends so it can be taken over by the state. No big buyouts needed..

attributes.action: Close legal loophole allowing NHS Price cap rules to be bypassed. Criminalise it
attributes.background: Several unscrupulous companies have made millions by legally bypassing the NHS price cap rules, by dropping the brand names of medicines and giving them their generic name.  This has caused astronomical price hikes, and patients are being refused their medicines because the NHS cannot afford them.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3623324/Millionaire-firms-forcing-price-common-NHS-drugs-262MILLION-year-exploiting-branding-loophole.html

attributes.action: Force advertisers to label manipulated images and provide link to original media
attributes.background: Our children and young adults are surrounded by media portraying unnatural and mostly unattainable body images. In many cases that media has been considerably digitally manipulated (eg, airbrushing) and I propose legislation for such images to include a link to the original unenhanced image.
attributes.additional_details: Many studies and reports show the negative effect on our younger generation of being constantly subjected to images of such extreme and artificial body images. By forcing the producers of such media to include a link to the original image (by way of, say, a reference number or QR code or similar) the media would be more transparent to such harmful image manipulation.

attributes.action: Change the 40 year rolling exemption for classic vehicles to 30 year.
attributes.background: I feel that the standard should be revised from 40 years to 30 years. Many cars over 25 years now are classic cars and are on classic car policys which do little mileage per year. Cars over 20 years are rarely seen on the road on a daily basis so I think the above should be revised.
attributes.additional_details: My vehicle is a classic car and is 26 years old. It is on classic car insurance as there are only 30 of my vehicle on the road and is classed as a classic vehicle by my insurer so why shouldn't I get historic car status in 4 years time.

attributes.action: Make GCSE Food Technology compulsory
attributes.background: Im a food lover and blogger and I want to make a change. I have loved food ever since I watched a Jamie Oliver christmas special back in 2006. My love for food and specifically helping younger people have grown over the years and now I want to kick up a fuss and make GCSE Food Technology compulsory
attributes.additional_details: The number of children taking Food Technology at GCSE is dropping. Too many kids nowadays are growing up not knowing how about food, with around 2 million children growing up with just one parent-it is questionable that mums and dads just don't have the time to teach their children how to cook/bake. The Department of Education quite clearly is TOO focused on wanting the children of the future to grow up to become more academic.

attributes.action: Register Endometriosis As a Disability
attributes.background: Hello My name is Selina-Louise and I Suffer With a Condition Called Endometriosis its a life changing condition which is extremely painful , it's where the lining of the uterus grows outside and can spread to the bowls and even lungs there is no cure.
attributes.additional_details: It should be a known condition and defiantly should be registered as a disability it's incredibly painful and has left some women infertile

attributes.action: Relax the rules on appearance to allow service personnel to blend in more.
attributes.background: After recent attempted kidnapping of a serviceman I think it's time that the rules governing appearance and grooming should be permanently relaxed to allow serviceman appear to be a member of public.

attributes.action: Incentivise businesses to increase the number of Standing Desks for employees
attributes.background: Employees spend 40+ hours a week at their desks, the lack of movement is a key problem in the obesity pandemic. Introducing standing desks DRAMATICALLY reduces this and the chances of type II diabetes. Getting businesses to bring in standing desks will help make Britain healthier. We need guidelines
attributes.additional_details:
Some of the benefits of standing desks have been ratified by research conducted in the States and in Britain. According to the researchers 'Sitting is the new smoking'. 

Below are some articles which list the benefits:

http://www.smithsonianmag.com/science-nature/five-health-benefits-standing-desks-180950259/?no-ist
https://authoritynutrition.com/7-benefits-of-a-standing-desk

attributes.action: Change policy "reducing drugs & misuse & dependence" for Fibromyalgia sufferers.
attributes.background:
it is trying to reduce the misuse of prescription drugs.
However , due to the stigma associated with Fibromyalgia & M.E, by some in the medical profession and the fact we are living with an invisible illness I feel many people living with Fibro & M.E are wrongly assumed to be misusing medication.
attributes.additional_details: I have gone from working hard all my life and never taking from the system to a person in agony most days, I need help with dressing, can't cook, can't drive, as a consequence of the pain all over my body I have become very depressed and fear for my future. I am no longer able to work and I am about to go on zero wages and will have to retire due to being too ill. I am 47. The only thing that helps me is my  medication which has taken 6 months to get right, but I now have to beg for weekly.

attributes.action: Invest more funds into research, management & recovery of CFS/ME Chronic Fatigue
attributes.background: After being diagnosed with CFS/ME Chronic Fatigue Syndrome in 2013, I've struggled to get any ongoing support for my symptoms, management and recovery. There's simply not enough understood about the condition within the NHS or the general public. More research and media exposion is urgently needed!
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.meassociation.org.uk

http://www.meassociation.org.uk/how-you-can-help/introduction-to-our-cbt-get-and-pacing-report/

http://www.meassociation.org.uk/research2015/cfsme-research-collaborative/

https://www.actionforme.org.uk

https://www.nice.org.uk/guidance/cg53

https://www.nice.org.uk/guidance/cg53/ifp/chapter/Managing-CFSME

https://www.nice.org.uk/guidance/cg53/evidence/full-guideline-196524109

attributes.action: To force all large retail outlets to buy British produce first at a fair price
attributes.background: With more and more produce available in the UK, why do we need to import 100's of tons of fruit and veg. I don't mind buying wonky carrots or odd shape veg, as long as it supports our farming/fishing industry. We need to support our own producers first.

attributes.action: Harsher punishments for people who discriminate.
attributes.background: Hate crime is on the rise. There was 4,345 cases of homophobic hate crime in 2011/12 and there was 5,597 cases in 2014/15. These criminals only get a fine or a short prison sentence for their crimes, this has to be changed.
attributes.additional_details: I know myself what it is like to be discriminated and disrespected, its an awful feeling and makes you question yourself and your existence.

attributes.action: We demand a response to the killing of African Americans by the U.S police.
attributes.background: Following the murders of Philando Castile and Alton Sterling, we demand an official response from Her Majesty’s Government in parliament and international pressure on the US Government, the US Congress and the US Department of Justice to reform its gun laws and police use of deadly force.
attributes.additional_details:
Over the years, investigations into the high profile police killings of the following victims have yielded no police convictions:
Mike Brown (unarmed, shot whilst complying with police orders)
Tamir Rice (12 year old shot without question for holding a toy gun)
Eric Garner (unarmed, choked to death)
Rekia Boyd (unarmed girl, shot without warning in the head)
Amadou Diallo (unarmed, shot 41 times)
Sean Bell (unarmed, shot 50 times on his wedding day)
Kimani Gray
Freddie Gray

attributes.action: Ban all HGVs overtaking restrict to inside lane only motorways dual carriageways
attributes.background: Lorries that overtake can sometimes take 2-5 miles to do so and should all be restricted to roughly the same maximum speed, I Believe that all HGVs should be banned from overtaking and be restricted to use if the inside lane only (except if Turing right dual carriageways )
attributes.additional_details: I'm sure we have all spent miles behind a lorry creeping past another whilst blocking a huge queue of cars and vehicles who are clearly faster moving only for the lorry to after an age pull back in front of the other lorry it's absolutely pointless and dangerous and costs money in water time for others and builds anger and frustration in all concerned

attributes.action: Make it Illegal to prescribe paracetamol
attributes.background: In 2015 over 22 million prescriptions for paracetamol were written at a cost to tax payers of over £80 million pounds – an average cost of £3.67 per prescription.....paracetamol can be purchased for 19p!!!!!

attributes.action: Abolish university fees: we should be entitled to free education.
attributes.background: Fees for attending university in England have rocketed. Now the government has announced that student maintenance grants will be replaced with loans in 2016, meaning that students could end up in up to £50,000 in debt.
